data.title: French cities (Civ6)
data.meta_description: French cities are cities that can be founded by the French civilization in Civilization VI and its expansions. The first city founded is the Capital, and the names of future cities are chosen at random from the list below. The names listed are default names; players can change their cities...
data.text: City Name Notes Capital Paris Cities Lyon Capital of the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region Rouen Capital of Normandy; formerly Ratumacos, a Gallic city Bordeaux Capital of the Nouvelle Aquitaine region; well known for wine production Marseille Capital of the Provence-Alpes-Côte-d'Azur region and second largest city in France Toulouse Capital of Occitanie La Rochelle Capital of the Charente-Maritime department which has one of the biggest Atlantic side ports Amboise Home of Château d'Amboise Nantes Major fishing port in the French coast; former capital of Brittany Rennes Capital of Bretagne region Calais Port city in Northern France Rheims Home of the Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Reims where French kings were crowned Avignon Site of the Avignon Papacy Boulogne Port city in Northern France, used for the Roman conquest of Britain Dijon Capital of the historical region of Burgundy Montpellier Capital of the Hérault Department Limoges Capital of the Haute-Vienne department Chartres Home of the Notre-Dame Cathedral Blois Capital of the Loir-et-Cher department Tours Largest city in the Centre-Val de Loire Region Verdun Site of the Battle of Verdun Grenoble Town known for winter sports Jarnac Site of the Battle of Jarnac; home of Mitterand, a former French president Amiens Home of Amiens Cathedral; once Samarobriva, which can be founded by the Gauls Troyes Capital of the Aube Department, Home of Troyes Cathedral Dieppe Location of the Dieppe Raid Toul Home of Toul Cathedral Briançon Commune in the Hautes-Alpes department Metz Capital of the Moselle Department; once Divodurum, which can be founded by the Gauls Carcassonne Fortified French town in the Aude Department Gap Commune in the Hautes-Alpes Department
